meanings.definition: The quality or state of being suitable for banking.
meanings.sent1: Her bankabilities made her the perfect candidate for the job at the financial institution.
meanings.sent2: The bankabilities of the new software system were quickly recognized by the banking industry.
meanings.sent3: His lack of bankabilities led to some comical mix-ups at the bank.
meanings.sent4: The bankabilities of the old building were like a sturdy vault, standing the test of time.
meanings.sent5: The importance of having strong bankabilities cannot be overstated in the financial world.

meanings.definition: The ability to be used as collateral for a loan.
meanings.sent1: The car's high value made it a great asset with bankabilities for securing a loan.
meanings.sent2: She decided to use her jewelry as bankabilities to secure the loan for her new business.
meanings.sent3: His collection of rare coins served as unique bankabilities for the loan.
meanings.sent4: The house's bankabilities were like a safety net, ensuring the loan would be repaid.
meanings.sent5: Having valuable bankabilities can make it easier to obtain a loan from the bank.
